statement: Introduce a domain-registered target handler contract for both apply-result and requeue; llm_calls services should dispatch via the registry instead of calling window_service directly, and target_registry should not instantiate WindowOrchestrator.
rationale: Current target_registry is window-specific and llm_calls services hardwire window applyRequestResult. A registry that maps key prefixes to handlers would reduce coupling and make new orchestrators (runs/experiments) pluggable.
keyAssumptions: custom_key prefixes remain a stable routing mechanism
new orchestrators will need both success and retry handling
validationCriteria: llm_job_service and llm_batch_service no longer import window_service
target_registry becomes a simple key switch or handler map
new domain handlers can be added without touching scheduler or llm_calls
critiquePoints: adds another indirection layer if only one orchestrator exists
requires new handler interfaces and tests to avoid silent routing failures
questions: Should apply-result routing live beside requeue routing in the same registry?
Do we also want a process-level registry for batch/job completion?
